H0.text: Kinetic energy is what a car loses when it is brought to a stop by friction on level ground.

H1.text: Residual energy is what a car loses when it is brought to a stop by friction on level ground.

H2.text: Exhibit energy is what a car loses when it is brought to a stop by friction on level ground.

H3.text: Mass energy is what a car loses when it is brought to a stop by friction on level ground.

A4.text: If the cyclist applies the brakes, the kinetic energy would be dissipated through friction as heat.

A5.text: The energy is not destroyed; it has only been converted to another form by friction.
